description: Borrowed from French brigue, of uncertain origin. Compare Italian briga, Spanish brega.

examples: the rise and decay of the Papal power , the politics of that Court , the Brigues of the Cardinals , the tricks of the Conclaves

verbs.description: brigue (third-person singular simple present brigues, present participle briguing, simple past and past participle brigued)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To achieve or obtain by underhand methods.
